channel.title: Casting :: Java Web Development
channel.description: When one class extends another, as HouseCat extends Cat, a field or local variable of the type of the base class may hold an object that is of the type of the child class. In other words, this is allowed: Cat suki = new HouseCat("Suki", 8);This is acceptable because a HouseCat is a Cat. Furthermore, when we call methods on such an object, the compiler is smart enough to determine which method it should call.
